nodes.text: Blurrgfire was a non-alcoholic beverage that imitated the sweet, sour, and spicy flavor of citrom juice. It was found throughout the galaxy and reportedly invented at Oga's Cantina in Black Spire Outpost on Batuu.

Blurrgfire was a classic non-alcoholic mixed drink found at cantinas throughout the galaxy. Its flavor imitated juice from a citrom, a fruit that did not stay fresh for long, but was both sweet and sour with a burst of heat. Blurrgfire was suitable for consumption by Artiodacs, humans, and Chadra-Fans, but it was not compatible with pit droids.

According to chef Strono Tuggs, Blurrgfire was invented by a bartender at Oga's Cantina, an establishment that was owned by Oga Garra and located in Black Spire Outpost on the Outer Rim planet Batuu. In Tuggs' account, the bartender came up with a recipe that combined various juices and spices to mimic the flavor of citrom. Tuggs claimed that he could not tell the difference between citrom and Blurrgfire because the imitation was so perfect, and he included the anecdote and a recipe for the drink in his cookbook, The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook. Although Tuggs did not specify the bartender's name, author and explorer Eloc Throno wrote in his Traveler's Guide to Batuu that Garra put "her own twist" on the drink.

Near the end of the Clone Wars, Blurrgfire was among the drink selections that the bartender Janott offered to Senator Padmé Amidala when she visited Oga's Cantina for a personal mission. It remained available at the cantina in 34 ABY, and on one occassion Resistance spy Vi Moradi drank it to stay sober and hangover-free while her ex-First Order companion Archex got intoxicated from a potent Jedi Mind Trick. It was also served at Aunt Z's Tavern on Castilon around the time of the First Order/Resistance War.

Blurrgfire was first mentioned on a trading card available at Disney's December 16, 2017 "Galactic Nights" session, which featured the cantina in the upcoming Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge park area. At the real-world Oga's Cantina bar, the menu's description reads, "Lemonade, pomegranate juice, and habanero-lime."

A recipe for Blurrgfire is included in the 2019 cookbook Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge: The Official Black Spire Outpost Cookbook, which was written by Chelsea Monroe-Cassel and Marc Sumerak. The ingredients for the beverage itself are pomegranate juice, habanero lime syrup, and prepared lemonade; before serving, a lime is run around the rim of a glass which is then dipped in red sea salt.
